Judul: Can Three-Body Recombination Purify a Quantum Gas?
Abstrak:
Three-body recombination in quantum gases is traditionally associated with heating, but it was recently
found that it can also cool the gas. We show that in a partially condensed three-dimensional homogeneous
Bose gas three-body loss could even purify the sample, that is, reduce the entropy per particle and increase the condensed fraction ?.We predict that the evolution of ? under continuous three-body loss can, depending on small changes in the initial conditions, exhibit two qualitatively different behaviors—if it is initially above a certain critical value, ? increases further, whereas clouds with lower initial ? evolve towards a thermal gas.These dynamical effects should be observable under realistic experimental conditions.
